title: Oregon loses DL Xadavien Sims to Arkansas via transfer portal
description: The Ducks have lost another defensive lineman to a Power 4 school, as Xadavien Sims has reportedly committed to Arkansas.
fullText:
It should be considered a strong representation of the Oregon Ducks' defensive line room to see a number of reserves enter the transfer portal and land at other Power 4 programs with chances to start. Redshirt freshman defensive lineman Xadavien Sims is no different, as he has reportedly committed to the Arkansas Razorbacks, per CBS Sports' Matt Zenitz.

Sims arrived at Oregon as a four-star and the No. 20 defensive lineman and No. 112 player overall in the 2024 recruiting class, per 247 Sports. He excelled at Durant High School in Durant, OK.

The 6-foot-3, 305-pounder appeared in two games as a true freshman, totaling one tackle and utilizing a redshirt. He didn't see much more time in 2025, as he also finished with just one tackle all season, coming in the¬†Ducks' 69-3 route against the¬†Oklahoma State Cowboys.

Arkansas has landed a commitment from Oregon defensive line transfer Xadavien Sims, his agency @APSportsAgency tells me, @chris_hummer and @CodyNagel247.

The 6-foot-3, 305-pounder was a Class of 2024 top-120 overall recruit. pic.twitter.com/jVdjgShPDS

‚Äî Matt Zenitz (@mzenitz) January 16, 2026

With the entire Ducks' defensive line returning for another season in 2026, Sims was not alone in entering the portal along the defensive line, as several of his teammates did the same.

Now, with his commitment to Arkansas, Sims will be able to compete for a starting job.

The Razorbacks went 2-10 in 2025, going winless (0-8) in the SEC and finishing the season on a 10-game losing streak. Defense was a massive issue, as they finished 129th in the country in points allowed per game and 116th in rushing yards allowed.

With the addition of Sims, Arkansas surely hopes that he can have a hand in turning that around. The former Duck will have three seasons of eligibility remaining.

Contact/Follow¬†@Ducks_Wire¬†on X (formerly Twitter) and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†to follow ongoing coverage of Oregon Ducks news, notes, and opinions.

This article originally appeared on Ducks Wire: Former Oregon Ducks DL Xadavien Sims commits to Arkansas

title: Former Cardinals HC Jonathan Gannon interviewing for Titans head coaching job
description: GLENDALE ‚Äì After a 15-36 record with the Arizona Cardinals, former head coach Jonathan Gannon‚Äôs reputation seemed to be in the mud. Despite the nice closing words general manager Monti Ossenfort and owner Michael Bidwill stated about the 42-year-old, the three straight losing seasons had many questioning how long it would take Gannon to get another NFL job.
fullText:
GLENDALE ‚Äì After a 15-36 record with the Arizona Cardinals, former head coach Jonathan Gannon‚Äôs reputation seemed to be in the mud. Despite the nice closing words general manager Monti Ossenfort and owner Michael Bidwill stated about the 42-year-old, the three straight losing seasons had many questioning how long it would take Gannon to get another NFL job.

Those rumors were quickly shut when he had an interview with the Dallas Cowboys regarding their defensive coordinator positioning. However, the bigger surprise came on Friday, when ESPN‚Äôs Adam Schefter reported that Gannon is meeting with the Tennessee Titans for their vacant head coaching position.

Arizona Cardinals head coach Jonathan Gannon addresses the media during a news conference at State Farm Stadium in Glendale on July 24, 2024.

Gannon was praised as a great leader and culture setter for Arizona by his players and executives. Despite it not turning into wins, Bidwill is happy with the job Gannon did, just couldn‚Äôt stack in wins. The Titans could be trying to bring in Gannon as its own culture setter, like the Cardinals believe he did with them.

The problem relies on the lack of results Gannon had in his first stint as a head coach. He had two seasons with four or less wins, and even loss to Tennessee this past season in an embarrassing home loss.

Jonathan Gannon is introduced as the new head coach of the Arizona Cardinals by team president Michael Bidwill and general manager Monti Ossenfort (right) during a news conference at the Cardinals training facility in Tempe on Feb. 16, 2023.

The Titans goal could be to try and find a head coach that‚Äôll help develop their franchise quarterback in Cam Ward. Gannon‚Äôs losses are hard to excuse, but he did have a stellar relationship with quarterback Kyler Murray during his tenure. Even after Murray‚Äôs silent benching, the two-time Pro Bowler posted on his X account about his support and love for Gannon after his departure.

Cardinals get interview with Robert Saleh for head coaching job in 2026

title: Report: Giants, John Harbaugh are "working through organizational and operational issues"
description: Nearly two days later, there's still no deal.
fullText:
The Giants and John Harbaugh are close to a deal. Unless they aren't.

Here's the latest from Jordan Raanan, who covers the Giants for ESPN.com: "My understanding is the Giants and John Harbaugh's side are working through organizational and operational issues. Still a gap to close before the deal is signed and sealed."

That's far more specific than the report from earlier in the day, by Adam Schefter of ESPN.com, that the two sides are haggling over "language."

Then there's this, from Ian O'Connor of TheAthletic.com: "Sounds like John Harbaugh & the Giants might take this deep into the night tonight, more likely tomorrow. Things are still OK. Hang in there. Still a lot to review in contract. John & [G.M.] Joe Schoen have gotten along. Can't see this unraveling. Both sides know way too much at stake."

O'Connor's nugget is noteworthy because he has a pipeline to Giants exec Chris Mara, who told O'Connor on Monday about the Sunday informal lunch meeting with Harbaugh.

Hovering over all of this is the question of whether and to what extent Harbaugh will be attempt to pry authority from Schoen. Harbaugh may want control over the roster. He may want final say over the draft. He may want Schoen to report to him.

Harbaugh has all the leverage. He had plenty before it was leaked that he was close to a deal with the Giants. Two days later, he has even more.

If this falls apart, the egg won't be on his face. It'll be on the Giants, who'll be forced to pivot to a coach who will always be perceived as Plan B. It will become, to use a technical term, a shitshow.

It sort of already is. Nearly 48 hours have passed since the reports emerged that Harbaugh and the Giants were closing in on a deal. The delay wouldn't be happening if it wasn't something big, because time is clearly of the essence ‚Äî for everyone involved.

title: Win Over Lille Gives Luis Enrique 100th Victory as PSG Manager
description: For matchday 18 of Ligue 1, Paris Saint-Germain defeated Lille 3-0 on Friday evening at the Parc des Princes.It was a home victory under the rain for the first match of the second half of the league s...
fullText:
For matchday 18 of Ligue 1, Paris Saint-Germain defeated Lille 3-0 on Friday evening at the Parc des Princes.

It was a home victory under the rain for the first match of the second half of the league season. After a scare early in the match when Olivier Giroud hit the crossbar (0-0, 2‚Ä≤), PSG controlled the game and won easily.

Ousmane Demb√©l√© and Bradley Barcola are the Parisian goalscorers. Demb√©l√© scored twice, his second brace of the season after the first in Toulouse (3-6, 30 August 2025).

Following a magnificent pass from Vitinha, the Ballon d‚ÄôOr winner opened the scoring with a wonderful left-footed strike from just outside the box, his shot hitting the post and beating Berke √ñzer for PSG‚Äôs first shot on target (1-0, 13‚Ä≤).

Demb√©l√© has scored in each of his last four starts for PSG in official competition. PSG‚Äôs second goal was a thing of beauty! D√©sir√© Dou√© found Demb√©l√© with a one-touch pass from 65 feet out in the box. The Parisian number 10 cut inside and feinted a shot. He held off three defenders before lobbing √ñzer (2-0, 64‚Ä≤).

Demb√©l√© scored his fifth goal of the Ligue 1 season under the watchful eye of Pauleta, who was also accustomed to scoring these kinds of incredible goals. The entire Parc des Princes applauded the Ballon d‚ÄôOr winner when he was replaced by Gon√ßalo Ramos (2-0, 75‚Ä≤).

In the additional time, PSG scored their third goal thanks to Barcola, who came on in the 63rd minute. Marius Broholm sent a risky pass to A√Øssa Mandi on his left, Barcola intercepted the ball in front of the Algerian and easily scored with his left foot (3‚Äì0, 90‚Äô+3).

With their elimination from the Coupe de France four days earlier in the Paris derby against Paris FC now forgotten, the European champions are putting pressure back on Lens. With this 13th victory in 18 matches, PSG reclaimed first place in Ligue 1 from Lens, which hosts Auxerre on Saturday.

The Parisians are two points ahead of Lens and have regained their confidence ahead of next Tuesday‚Äôs UEFA Champions League match against Sporting. The objective is very clear: Secure a place in the top eight in Portugal and go straight through to the round of 16.

title: Key player will be sidelined for the Texans vs Patriots this weekend
description: A key player will miss the Houston Texans' Divisional round matchup against the New England Patriots this weekend.
fullText:
A key player will miss the Houston Texans' Divisional round matchup against the New England Patriots this weekend.

Texans wide receiver Nico Collins has been ruled out of the game against the Patriots after suffering a concussion a week ago against the Pittsburgh Steelers. Collins was officially ruled out on Friday after missing the entire week of practice.

A Pro Bowler each of the last two seasons, Collins led Houston in 2025 with 71 receptions, 6 touchdowns, and 1,117 receiving yards. He appeared in 15 games this season. Both rookies out of Iowa State will be expected to step up in his absence. Jaylin Noel, who caught 26 passes on the year with 2 touchdowns, and Jayden Higgins, who caught 41 passes with 6 touchdowns.

After Collins left last week's contest, fellow wide receiver and veteran Christian Kirk would fill in nicely with 8 receptions for 144 yards and a touchdown. Other weapons for the Texans include Dalton Schultz and Xavier Hutchinson, who will also need to act as security blankets for the great pass rush of the New England Patriots. In the secondary for New England, they will get Christian Gonzalez back after suffering a head injury of his own last weekend.

This article originally appeared on Touchdown Wire: Key player for the Houston Texans set to miss game against Patriots

title: Houston Rockets Entering Pivotal Stretch of Games to End the Month
description: Momentum shifts on a critical home stand. Can the Rockets rebound from recent losses and climb the standings with tough matchups ahead?
fullText:
Through the first half of January, this Rockets team has struggled to play with much consistency. Starting the first full month of the season with an impressive 11-2 record in November, the wins have slowly started to dwindle down as the months progress. After just barely making it through December with a winning record, StatMuse shows Houston currently standing at 3-5 in 2026. This rocky start to the new year had Rockets fans seeing their team fall to the 7th seed, although they have since climbed back out of the Play-In Tournament. Ultimately, that placement in the standings is more directly related to the Phoenix Suns losing back to back games. Relying on other teams losing is certainly not how Houston should want to make their way up in the standings ‚Äî‚Äî if they want to earn themselves a home-court advantage in the playoffs, they might need to go on a win streak before this month ends.

Currently in the midst of a five game home stand, this seems like an optimal stretch to gain some positive momentum as a team. Alperen Sengun returned from injury to help his squad start off with a much needed win against Chicago, but the second of five straight at the Toyota Center didn‚Äôt go quite as well. The rematch of a double overtime thriller on Opening Night this season was a bit of a disappointment, with fans across the league watching a 20 point loss. It‚Äôs virtually impossible to beat the reigning champs while only making 33.7-percent of your shots for a total of 91 points, per Roundtable. While nights like this happen in an arduous 82 game NBA, they‚Äôll have to bounce back just over 24 hours later to face Minnesota on Friday.

Though fans worldwide would probably like to see Anthony Edwards play in this matchup, it appears he‚Äôll be sitting this game out. While this seems like it‚Äôd give Houston a better chance to win, the Timberwolves still have a 4-2 record without their superstar this season, so they can‚Äôt slack off. Minnesota is sitting relatively comfortably in the 4th seed, but defeating them would allow the Rockets to match the Lakers‚Äô 24-15 record. Their Christmas Day victory has actually given Houston a tiebreaker, meaning they‚Äôd leapfrog LA for the 5th seed. Some possible motivation for this teetering team to pick up a win.

After a day to rest, the New Orleans Pelicans come to town for another revenge game on Sunday. In their only matchup this season, Saddiq Bey played the unlikely hero for New Orleans, helping them escape with a 133-128 overtime victory, including a 25-point comeback. Being only their 6th win of the season (5-22 up to that point), the Rockets need to avoid giving that same team their 11th win of the season. They desperately need to improve on their 12-9 record against losing teams if they hope to compete against winning teams in the long run.

This five game home stand comes to an end with an alien invasion from San Antonio, as Victor Wembanyama the Spurs come to display their talents in the first ‚ÄúNBA Rivals Week‚Äù matchup. Another very key game against a team that‚Äôs been near the top of the conference all season, with them returning to Houston for another game just eight days later. Currently sitting three and a half games behind the Spurs, the outcome of those two matchups can play a big role in the final playoff seeding in April.

With nine games still remaining this month, Houston has ample time to turn their 3-5 record around. Only three of those games are on the road, but traveling to Philly, Detroit, and Atlanta gives Houston a great challenge against eastern conference playoff teams. A nice mix of games, ending just in time for the February 5th trade deadline. This month will undoubtedly tell everyone what they need to know about the Rockets, and what moves they may or may not need to make. If more wins don‚Äôt start to pile up, I‚Äôd expect to see some moves to fortify this roster.

title: Masters match schedule, BBC coverage times, results & prize money
description: Match schedule, results, prize money, former winners and BBC coverage details from the 2026 Masters at Alexandra Palace in London.
fullText:
Shaun Murphy got the defence of his Masters title under way on Sunday, 11 January at London's Alexandra Palace - but was dumped out on day one.

The Englishman, who beat Kyren Wilson 10-7 in last year's final, was bidding to win the tournament for a third time, having also won the tournament in 2015.

He fell to exciting young Chinese player Wu Yize, though, and fellow former winner Mark Selby also lost later in the day.

Eight-time champion Ronnie O'Sullivan pulled out of the tournament because of medical reasons and was replaced by Chris Wakelin, who was defeated by Neil Robertson.

The Masters, a non-ranking event for the world's top 16 players, is the second Triple Crown competition of the season.

The UK Championship, which was won by Selby in December, and the World Championship, which starts in April, are the other two Triple Crown tournaments.

This year's Masters featured five Chinese players for the first time in the tournament's 51-year history.

Keep reading to find out the match schedule, BBC TV coverage details, prize money, former champions and maximum breaks at the Masters.

Every first round Masters tie finishes 6-2 at odds of 220,000-1

O'Sullivan withdraws from Masters for medical reasons

As defending champion, world number seven Murphy began as top seed for the 52nd Masters tournament.

China's Zhao Xintong, who started with a win against 16th seed Gary Wilson on Monday, was promoted to second seed from a ranking of ninth because of his status as world champion.

However, he was beaten 6-5 in a decider by two-time Masters champion John Higgins in the last eight.

World number one Judd Trump, champion in 2019 and 2023, is the third seed. The Englishman will be keen to get 2026 off to a flying start after failing to win a title last year.

He advanced past 2011 champion Ding Junhui and Mark Allen and will now take on John Higgins in the semi-finals on Saturday.

Kyren Wilson, last year's runner-up, is seeded fourth. The 2024 world champion struggled at the UK Championship, saying he was close to having a "mental breakdown" during a 6-4 defeat by Elliot Slessor.

But he looked sharp on Tuesday when beating Si Jiahui and then came through a classic against two-time winner Neil Robertson to reach the last four.

Robertson leads the one-year ranking list thanks to notable wins at the lucrative Saudi Masters and the World Grand Prix.

Mark Williams, one part of snooker's famous 'Class of 92' alongside, Higgins and O'Sullivan lost in round one to Northern Ireland's Allen.

Selby looked back to his formidable best at the UK Championship but fell to Xiao Guodong on Sunday to end his 2026 Masters hopes.

Wilson and wife Sophie setting up family support network

Why snooker's golden generation are still shining at 50

What's behind snooker's 147 boom?

BBC Sport has comprehensive live coverage of every shot across BBC One, BBC Two, BBC Four, BBC iPlayer and the BBC Sport website and app.

You can also watch the live streams and follow text updates on the BBC Sport website and app.

All times GMT. Schedules and coverage times are subject to late changes.

13:00 - Judd Trump v John Higgins

13:00-16:30 - BBC One, BBC iPlayer, BBC Sport website and BBC Sport app

16:30-17:30 - BBC Two, BBC iPlayer, BBC Sport website and BBC Sport app

19:00-22:00 - BBC Two, BBC iPlayer, BBC Sport website and BBC Sport app

13:00-17:15 - BBC Two, BBC iPlayer, BBC Sport website and BBC Sport app

19:00-22:00 - BBC Two, BBC iPlayer, BBC Sport website and BBC Sport app

Neil Robertson 6-2 Chris Wakelin

Kyren Wilson 6-5 Neil Robertson

Ronnie O'Sullivan has won the tournament the most times and is also the youngest and the oldest Masters champion.

The Englishman won the Masters for the first time in 1995 aged 19 and his eighth in 2024 aged 48.

Stephen Hendry lifted the trophy six times while Steve Davis, Paul Hunter, Mark Selby and Cliff Thorburn have all won it three times.

Mark Williams, John Higgins, Neil Robertson, Judd Trump, Shaun Murphy and Alex Higgins have all won the title twice.

The tournament trophy was renamed the Paul Hunter Trophy in 2017 as a tribute to the three-time Masters champion, who died aged 27 in 2006.

'Paul was fun': Remembering snooker's lost great 20 years on

2025: Shaun Murphy beat Kyren Wilson 10-7

2024: Ronnie O'Sullivan beat Ali Carter 10-7

2023: Judd Trump beat Mark Williams 10-8

2022: Neil Robertson beat Barry Hawkins 10-4

2021: Yan Bingtao beat John Higgins 10-8

2020: Stuart Bingham beat Ali Carter 10-8

2019: Judd Trump beat Ronnie O'Sullivan 10-4

2018: Mark Allen beat Kyren Wilson 10-7

2017: Ronnie O'Sullivan beat Joe Perry 10-7

2016: Ronnie O'Sullivan beat Barry Hawkins 10-1

Shaun Murphy made the sixth maximum at the Masters with a 147 break in his semi-final victory over Mark Allen last year.

Kirk Stevens recorded the first in 1984, while Ding Junhui (twice), Marco Fu and Allen have also potted 147s.

title: We asked 6 Olympians what they think about the Milan rink issues. Here‚Äôs what they said
description: The hockey arena at the 2026 Olympics won‚Äôt be perfect. But how much do the players care?
fullText:
NHL players have not competed in the Olympics since 2014. After more than a decade of them asking to go, the league finally relented ahead of the 2026 Milano-Cortina Games. But their return isn‚Äôt as ceremonious as the players had dreamed.

It‚Äôs well-documented that the Milano Santagiulia Ice Hockey Arena, the main venue for both men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs games, won‚Äôt be ideal. The main concerns include:

Construction not being fully completed until the week the hockey games begin.

The playing surface being more than 3 feet smaller than intended.

Some of the locker rooms not being up to NHL standards.

Ice quality not being suitable for several games a day.

But after missing the opportunity to attend so many times, do the players actually care if conditions aren‚Äôt ideal? We asked six players, representing four countries, for their thoughts.

Construction resumes today on the Milan Olympic hockey rink at "full speed," according to organizers. There's a lot to get done still 

Among critical unfinished business is completing most of the dressing rooms in a building beside the arena, which looked like this Friday night: pic.twitter.com/oPq89lmeVW

‚Äî Chris Johnston (@reporterchris) January 12, 2026

The Deseret News‚Äô conversations with Olympians-to-be date back to mid-December. They come from players representing four countries and three NHL teams.

The consensus? They‚Äôre happy to be able to attend, regardless of the circumstances.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll play anywhere,‚Äù said Utah Mammoth captain and Team USA forward Clayton Keller.

Having played two seasons at the infamous Mullett Arena in Arizona, Keller is no stranger to less-than-favorable circumstances. He also mentioned that they had mobile locker rooms at the World Championship last spring.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sure they‚Äôll figure it out,‚Äù he said.

Florida Panthers star Brad Marchand, who is set to play for Team Canada, was particularly unconcerned about the 3 feet missing from the neutral zone.

‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt matter,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre playing the same game no matter what. The speed of the game is so fast anyways, the rink size doesn‚Äôt mean anything. Guys don‚Äôt care. No one‚Äôs talked about it. No one‚Äôs worried about it.‚Äù

Colorado Avalanche superstar Nathan MacKinnon, who earned the 4 Nations Face-Off MVP award in addition to the trophy with Team Canada last February, isn‚Äôt worried about things that he can‚Äôt change.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs out of my control,‚Äù he told the Deseret News. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just going to go do my best. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôll change too much.‚Äù

Germany‚Äôs JJ Peterka would have preferred international-sized ice, rather than the smaller, NHL-regulation dimensions that they‚Äôd intended to use (to be clear, the rink ended up being even smaller than NHL playing surfaces).

‚ÄúI think, for nations like us, it would have been better if the rink would have been bigger than the NHL ice, but at the end of the day, I think everyone‚Äôs just so excited to finally play (in the) Olympics,‚Äù Peterka said. ‚ÄúSo, like, for me, personally, I don‚Äôt really care, to be honest. I just want to be there and have fun there.‚Äù

Finland‚Äôs Artturi Lehkonen and Olli M√§√§tt√§ both expressed that they hadn‚Äôt spent much time thinking about it.

‚ÄúWe haven‚Äôt really talked about it. I think everybody trusts that it‚Äôs going to be great, so I think we‚Äôre all just excited to go,‚Äù M√§√§tt√§ said.

If those six players represent the majority‚Äôs opinion, fans should be in store for another all-time tournament.

title: MSU football running back reportedly set to return for 2026 season
description: A Michigan State football reserve young running back will reportedly return for another season with the Spartans in 2026
fullText:
A Michigan State football reserve young running back will reportedly return for another season with the Spartans in 2026.

Michigan State redshirt freshman running back Zion Gist will reportedly return for the 2026 season. According to Connor Earegood of The Detroit News, Gist's "advisers" posted on Instagram that he has signed a contract extension to return to Michigan State for the 2026 season.

Gist didn't see any game action this past season and redshirted as a true freshman. He was twice named Scout Player of the Week this past year, and will have four years of eligibility remaining.

Out of high school, Gist was a three-star prospect from Frankfort, Ill. He will have an opportunity to earn playing time next year for the Spartans.

MSU RB Zion Gist‚Äôs advisers posted this on Instagram about half an hour ago. pic.twitter.com/Z1RfHzJwTC

‚Äî Connor Earegood (@ConnorEaregood) January 16, 2026

title: Blue Jackets' trade plans for Boone Jenner, Charlie Coyle revealed by The Athletic
description: Columbus has a choice to make.
fullText:
Blue Jackets' trade plans for Boone Jenner, Charlie Coyle revealed by The Athletic originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

It's closing in on being decision time for the Columbus Blue Jackets.

They're outside the playoffs as things stand, and if it continues this way, they'll have to choose what to do with their veteran forwards who would be valuable trade chips.

Among those who could be available: Boone Jenner and Charlie Coyle.

The Athletic's Harman Dayal broke down the challenges in a new article on Friday.

The key variable still being figured out is the new head coach in town, Rick Bowness.

"It‚Äôd be wise to see how the team performs over the next 10-15 games under Bowness before the deadline," Dayal writes. "If they go on a heater, great, you can justify keeping everyone. If not, the Blue Jackets would be wise to either re-sign or trade their valuable pending UFAs, because missing the playoffs¬†and¬†losing them in the offseason for nothing would sting."

There's almost nothing Coyle doesn't do well.

"Coyle is having an outstanding season ‚Äî he leads all Columbus forwards in five-on-five points and has delivered Selke-caliber two-way results (earning 54 percent of expected goals and 60 percent of actual goals) despite handling some of the toughest matchups of all NHL forwards," Dayal writes. "He‚Äôd be a highly sought-after trade chip if he were made available, especially with how high the demand for quality centers is."

Jenner is a consistently productive player, too.

"Jenner would also fetch a lucrative return because of his production, versatility (he can play center or wing), and big-bodied, hard-nosed playing style," Dayal writes.

The contending teams in the NHL will be keeping an eye on Columbus.

If the Blue Jackets cool off after an initially fast start with Bowness, there could be some sales coming.

MORE:¬†Senators' forfeited draft pick could cost them dearly

title: James Harrison believes playoff record, lack of coaching tree disqualify Mike Tomlin from Hall of Fame
description: Harrison's NFL career took off at the start of Tomlin's Steelers tenure.
fullText:
James Harrison's string of five straight Pro Bowl seasons started when Mike Tomlin took over as the Pittsburgh Steelers' head coach in 2007. The tenacious linebacker won his second Super Bowl ring and only NFL Defensive Player of the Year award under Tomlin.

But Harrison doesn't believe Tomlin belongs in the Pro Football Hall of Fame after he voluntarily ended his 19-season run leading the Steelers. Harrison said so on Friday's episode of his show "Deebo & Joe," which he co-hosts with former Steelers and Cleveland Browns cornerback Joe Haden.

Haden, a three-time Pro Bowler who played for Tomlin from 2017 to '21, posed the question, "Is Coach T a Hall of Fame coach, in your opinion?"

Harrison responded with a two-letter answer: "No."

Taken aback, Haden said, "OK. So now, yeah, that's actually crazy."

That's when Harrison dove into his explanation:

"He hasn't made disciples," Harrison said. "You're telling me you're a Hall of Fame coach, but no one has followed you? ... He's the only coach that has coached this long and does not have a tree, bro."

Deebo did not hold back. Nineteen years or not, he says Mike Tomlin is not a Hall of Fame coach and points straight at the postseason record and the empty coaching tree.@jharrison9292 @joehaden23 #DeeboAndJoe pic.twitter.com/kUXagXFhz1

‚Äî Deebo & Joe (@deeboandjoe) January 16, 2026

Harrison was critical of the fact that during Tomlin's nearly two-decade tenure in Pittsburgh, he didn't have a single assistant transition directly from his staff to a head-coaching position in the league.

"I'm not going to not give him the Hall of Fame nod because he's bad at hiring offensive coordinators," said Haden, who was in clear disagreement with Harrison on the subject.

Harrison didn't back down. In fact, he even speculated that Tomlin steered away from bringing in top-notch coordinators in order to keep the spotlight on himself.

"Is it enough spotlight to go around?" Harrison said.

"You got to realize, a lot of coaches, when they get this head coach thing, it's a lot of ego that go with that. ... Now, a great coach, dude, the measurement of greatness, it's not based on personal experiences and relationship you had with them. It is purely on what you did as a coach. Did you get championships?"

Haden countered with, "What about wins and losses?"

Tomlin, after all, piled up 193 regular-season wins, tied with Chuck Noll for the most recorded by a head coach in Steelers history. He was, however, just 8-12 in the playoffs and lost his last seven postseason games.

That's where Harrison headed with his argument.

"When you look at the greats, the measurement of greatness for all-time greats, like everybody is saying right now, nobody has a negative postseason record," Harrison said.

Haden maintained that Tomlin is a Hall of Fame coach because he delivered a Super Bowl to the Steel City and consistently put Pittsburgh in position to contend. The Steelers won eight AFC North titles and didn't have a single losing season with Tomlin in charge.

Just last month, Harrison was at it again. He played for Tomlin from 2007 to '12 but apparently wasn't all too impressed.

"As much as I hate to say this, I have never been a person that thought Coach Tomlin was a great coach," Harrison said during a Dec. 1 episode of his show, following the Steelers' Week 13 defeat to the Buffalo Bills that came with "Fire Tomlin" chants.

Harrison continued at the time: "I thought he was a good coach. ... A good coach gets you to play to your potential. And right now, the players we have on that team I have seen play, I know they can do it. I have seen them do it.

"And they're not playing up to their potential. And a great coach gets you to play beyond your potential."

The Steelers bounced back from that loss to the Bills and won the AFC North before their latest one-and-done playoff appearance and Tomlin's subsequent resignation.

title: Kyle Gibson Presents Case for St. Louis Cardinals to Keep Brendan Donovan
description: The former pitcher offered some reasoning for St. Louis to hold onto the 2025 All-Star
fullText:
For most of the offseason, it's felt like an inevitability Brendan Donovan will be traded by the St. Louis Cardinals.

There's been chatter of the Cardinals potentially moving the second baseman dating back to last offseason, with the Seattle Mariners at the forefront of most rumors.

St. Louis has a lot of reasons to trade Donovan. The team is in a rebuild and has already moved on from several of its best players.

Donovan, who's coming off his first career All-Star selection, will likely earn the Cardinals the best return out of the players they've already traded.

Donovan is unlikely to have more value in the trade market than he does right now. In addition to being named an All-Star this past season, he's under arbitration through 2027 and is capable of playing second base and the outfield.

St. Louis could end up with multiple top 100 prospects in a potential trade for Donovan but at least one former player is one board with keeping him.

In a recent episode of the Cardinal Territory podcast, former Cardinals pitcher Kyle Gibson laid out the case for keeping Donovan on the organization and potentially reconstructing the team around him.

"Is there value in holding Brendan Donovan? Yeah," Gibson said on the Cardinal Territory podcast. "He's an All-Star utility player, utility Gold Glove. He's a stud. Of course there's value and I think there's value to building your team around him. It's gonna be really interesting as we see what Major League Baseball and what these teams do as they shift. Clearly there's teams making a little bit of a shift from swing-and-miss, a little bit of a shift from homer-heavy, swing-and-miss heavy, to some contact. And I just think (Donovan) is just a guy that does that really well, (Alec Burleson) is a guy that does that really well. ... I've never been on board with trading Brendan Donovan. And I say 'never' until maybe a really good trade package comes up. But, man, I just think he's a guy that you figure out how to keep here."

‚ÄúIs there value in holding Brendan Donovan? Yes!‚Äù

@KGibb44 thinks the Cardinals should hold onto Brendan Donovan because of his low swing and miss profile. pic.twitter.com/YOCPKbgrya

‚Äî Cardinal Territory (@CardTerritory) January 15, 2026

Gibson also mentioned 2025 Gold Glove-winning shortstop Masyn Winn as a player akin to Donovan that St. Louis can build around.

Donovan slashed .287/.353/.422 with a .775 OPS in 118 games and hit 32 doubles and 10 home runs with 50 RBIs.

In four years in the majors, Donovan hasn't had a batting average below .278, an on-base percentage below .342 or an OPS below .759 in a single season.

The Cardinals have been steadily building assets in their farm system via the MLB Draft, the international signing period and the various trades they've made in the last year.

Trading Donovan would likely give St. Louis enough depth in the minor leagues to build the roster how the front office sees fit. However, there's enough quality players in the minors for the Cardinals to put together a decent squad with Donovan as the centerpiece, if the team commits to extending him.

Remember to join our CARDINALS on ROUNDTABLE community, which is FREE! You can post your own thoughts, in text or video form, and you can engage with our Roundtable staff, as well as other CARDINALS fans. If prompted to download the Roundtable APP, that's free too!

title: Mets Reportedly Still In On Cody Bellinger Despite Bo Bichette Deal
description: When the New York Mets signed Bo Bichette on Friday to a three-year, $126 million deal, many MLB fans (particularly those rooting for the New York Yankees) assumed that the Mets halt their pursuit of Cody Bellinger. That‚Äôs not what‚Äôs happening, according to New York Mets On SI‚Äôs Pat Ragazzo. ‚ÄúThe Mets are still in [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
When the New York Mets signed Bo Bichette on Friday to a three-year, $126 million deal, many MLB fans (particularly those rooting for the New York Yankees) assumed that the Mets halt their pursuit of Cody Bellinger.

That‚Äôs not what‚Äôs happening, according to New York Mets On SI‚Äôs Pat Ragazzo.

‚ÄúThe Mets are still in play for free agent first baseman/outfielder Cody Bellinger, as sources told Mets On SI on Friday,‚Äù Ragazzo wrote.

‚ÄúThe versatile Bellinger fits the Mets at multiple positions given his above average defense at first base and in center and left field. Bellinger‚Äôs left-handed bat would also provide added protection in the Mets‚Äô lineup for Francisco Lindor, Juan Soto and Bichette. Bellinger also has a .929 career OPS at Citi Field in 20 games.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe Mets could plug Bellinger in center or left field, or at first base if they aren‚Äôt comfortable playing Jorge Polanco and Brett Baty at the position,‚Äù Ragazzo added.

Bellinger has carved out a dynamic nine-year MLB career marked by peaks and valleys. Debuting with the Los Angeles Dodgers in 2017, he earned Rookie of the Year honors with 39 home runs. His 2019 MVP season saw him smash 47 homers while batting .305, followed by a 2020 World Series title. Injuries hampered him in 2021-22, leading to a non-tender and a rebound with the Chicago Cubs in 2023 (.307 average, 26 homers). In 2024, he hit .266 with 18 long balls before opting out of his deal.

Bellinger‚Äôs 2025 campaign with the Yankees represented a strong resurgence, batting .272 with 29 home runs, 98 RBIs, and 13 stolen bases in 152 games. He posted an .813 OPS, 125 wRC+, and delivered memorable moments like a three-homer game against the Cubs, aiding the Yankees‚Äô playoff push.

Bellinger remains a free agent, with ongoing talks stalled over contract length (he seeks seven years, while New York offers five at $155-160 million).

Bo Bichette Signing Creates Perfect Trade Fit For Red Sox

title: Global sports face challenges from 'AI slop' misinformation
description: A study by AI risk management platform Alethea into the surge in artificial intelligence-generated fake content, dubbed "AI slop," has warned sports teams, leagues and fans of the risks posed by increasingly sophisticated digital misinformation.  Retired NFL player Jason Kelce never said ‚Äã2026 Super Bowl halftime singer Bad Bunny's critics were "a bad fit for America's future".  San Francisco 49ers tight end George Kittle never ranted about slain ‚Äåconservative activist Charlie Kirk and politics in football.
fullText:
Jan 16 (Reuters) - A study by AI risk management platform Alethea into the surge in artificial intelligence-generated fake content, dubbed "AI slop," has warned sports teams, leagues and fans of the risks posed by increasingly sophisticated digital misinformation.

Retired NFL player Jason Kelce never said ‚Äã2026 Super Bowl halftime singer Bad Bunny's critics were "a bad fit for America's future".

San Francisco 49ers tight end George Kittle never ranted about slain ‚Äåconservative activist Charlie Kirk and politics in football.

However, thousands of people believed they did and that is the problem.

"Teams and players are suddenly being accused of things that are completely fabricated," Lisa Kaplan, ‚Äåfounder and CEO of Alethea, told Reuters on Friday, adding that the evolution of AI tools has made fake news a more daunting challenge.

"Content now looks real and is produced at a volume that makes it hard for the average person to determine if it's authentic," she said.

"Before, fake news often relied on human labour to repetitively copy and paste content. Today, AI can impersonate brands and create engaging images that mimic genuine announcements."

Kaplan noted that this wave of AI-generated misinformation has disrupted the traditional monetisation ‚Å†model of sports media. "These networks drive engagement to questionable websites, ‚Äåskew advertising metrics, and can even create scenarios that could manipulate betting markets," she added.

C Shawn Eib, Alethea's Head of Investigations, described how these networks use tactics such as making multiple disjointed announcements, like the conflicting claims that former Baltimore Ravens coach ‚ÄçJohn Harbaugh had been hired by multiple teams at the same time.

"When a single figure appears to be linked with several teams at the same time, it quickly becomes clear that an AI system is behind the creation of these images," Eib explained.

AI DECEPTION CAN EXPLOIT 'RAGE BAIT'

The content follows a formula: fake game updates, nonexistent celebrity feuds, manufactured scandals, and politicised ‚Äãquotes falsely attributed to star players.

The fabricated Kelce and Kittle quotes are prime examples. Both NFL stars publicly denied making comments they never said after the ‚Äåposts went viral.

"If fans, players and even entire franchises fall prey to these manipulated narratives, it risks damaging reputations, undermining trust and even politicising sport," Alethea's VP of Communications Kaila Ryan said.

"Sports organisations need to proactively manage their brands and digital safety. It is crucial for teams and leagues to start monitoring these risks, work together across communications, legal and security teams, and educate fans to verify announcements from official channels," she added.

The business impact extends beyond reputational harm.

These networks siphon ad revenue from legitimate sports media and distort audience metrics. Some outbound links have been flagged for phishing and malicious redirects, presenting real fraud risk to fans.

The problem ‚Å†is not limited to the NFL. Alethea discovered similar operations targeting the NBA, WNBA, MLB, NHL, ‚ÄãNASCAR, Formula 1, IndyCar and professional tennis.

Kaplan added that beyond monetisation, sport remains a rare cultural ‚Äãtouchpoint that unites people, making them attractive targets for influence operations, and she pointed to Russia's alleged exploitation of then-49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick's 2018 'Take a Knee' protest as a precedent.

In a 2019 report, the Senate Intelligence Committee revealed that Russian trolls had focused heavily ‚Äçon the kneeling debate as part of ‚Å†a broader effort to stoke racial tensions and divide the U.S. following the 2016 election.

"Kaepernick's protests were exploited for a purpose that had nothing to do with sport. Instead, it's a way of leveraging a cultural touchstone and turning it into something that polarises people," said Kaplan.

"Teams need to ‚Å†work in unison to defend their identities and protect their fans from falling victim to fraud or manipulation," she added, noting that the best advice for fans is to be vigilant.

"Verify breaking news ‚Äåthrough official team channels, don't click links in suspicious page comments and remember that outrage is often the product, not the by-product, ‚Äåof what you're seeing".

title: Leonhard and Martindale among 8 candidates interviewed by Jets for defensive coordinator job
description: Denver Broncos assistant coach Jim Leonhard and longtime NFL assistant Wink Martindale were among eight candidates interviewed by the New York Jets for their vacant defensive coordinator position.  The Jets announced Friday they also completed interviews ‚Äî all through video meetings ‚Äî this week with Chris Harris, who served as New York's interim defensive coordinator after Steve Wilks was fired last month, Mathieu Araujo, Ephraim Banda, DeMarcus Covington, Daronte Jones and Jim O‚ÄôNeil.
fullText:
Denver Broncos assistant coach Jim Leonhard and longtime NFL assistant Wink Martindale were among eight candidates interviewed by the New York Jets for their vacant defensive coordinator position.

The Jets announced Friday they also completed interviews ‚Äî all through video meetings ‚Äî this week with Chris Harris, who served as New York's interim defensive coordinator after Steve Wilks was fired last month, Mathieu Araujo, Ephraim Banda, DeMarcus Covington, Daronte Jones and Jim O‚ÄôNeil.

Jets coach Aaron Glenn will next shorten the list and meet with remaining candidates for in-person interviews.

New York's defense was one of the NFL's worst during a 3-14 season, Glenn's first as head coach. Wilks was fired after 14 games and Harris, the Jets' defensive backs coach and pass game coordinator, took over the play calling.

‚ÄúCompatibility is just as important as coachability,‚Äù Glenn said last week when asked about what he's looking for in a defensive coordinator. ‚ÄúSo, I want to make sure we see things the same way and I want to make sure that we can vibe as far as sitting down and talking about how we see football.‚Äù

Leonhard, a former safety who played for the Jets from 2009-11, has some familiarity with Glenn. In Leonhard's final season as a player in 2014 for Cleveland, Glenn served as the Browns' assistant defensive backs coach.

Leonhard began his coaching career as an assistant at Wisconsin, his alma mater, in 2016 before becoming the Badgers' defensive coordinator and later the interim head coach in 2022. After one year at Illinois, Leonhard joined Sean Payton's staff in Denver as the defensive backs coach and pass game coordinator in 2024 before adding assistant head coach to his duties this season.

Martindale was the defensive coordinator at Michigan the last two seasons after a two-year stint in the same role with the Giants. After several college stops to begin his coaching career, Martindale had NFL stints with the Raiders, Broncos and Ravens.

Araujo spent the last four seasons with the Dolphins, first as an assistant defensive backs coach for Mike McDaniel and then as the cornerbacks coach.

Banda coached the Browns‚Äô safeties the last three seasons under Kevin Stefanski after several college stops, including Texas, Mississippi State, Miami and Utah State.

Covington joined the Packers this season as their defensive line coach and run game coordinator after spending eight seasons with the Patriots, including last season as the defensive coordinator.

Jones has spent the last five seasons with the Vikings as the defensive backs coach and also served as the pass game coordinator the last three. He has also had NFL coaching stints with the Dolphins and Bengals.

O‚ÄôNeil has been with the Lions the past two years, including the 2024 season when Glenn was the defensive coordinator in Detroit. He's a defensive assistant who also coaches the Lions' safeties. He was a defensive quality control coach for the Jets in 2009 and their assistant defensive backs coach from 2010-12. O'Neil also has spent time with the Bills, Browns, 49ers and Raiders.

title: NFL Insider Suggests What Team Might Trade To Acquire Ex-Patriots QB Mac Jones
description: The 2026 NFL Draft is expected to lack top-tier quarterbacks, which could lead to a flurry of veteran quarterbacks changing teams this offseason. One signal-caller who is expected to draw considerable attention on the trade market is Mac Jones. Jones signed a two-year contract worth $8.4 million with the 49ers this offseason. With Brock Purdy [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The 2026 NFL Draft is expected to lack top-tier quarterbacks, which could lead to a flurry of veteran quarterbacks changing teams this offseason. One signal-caller who is expected to draw considerable attention on the trade market is Mac Jones.

Jones signed a two-year contract worth $8.4 million with the 49ers this offseason. With Brock Purdy established as San Francisco‚Äôs starting quarterback, the 49ers may consider trading Jones.

With the limited number of quarterbacks in free agency, Jones could potentially bring in a significant amount of draft capital. According to Sports Illustrated‚Äôs Albert Breer, it‚Äôs likely that Jones could yield a Day 2 and a Day 3 pick in return.

‚ÄúI‚Äôd say a Day 2 pick, and maybe a Day 3 pick swap for Jones,‚Äù Breer wrote on Friday. ‚ÄúThe Jets‚Äô trade of Sam Darnold to the Panthers might be the best recent comp I could find, and New York got a 2021 sixth-round pick and ‚Äô22 second- and fourth-rounders for the quarterback. I‚Äôd guess the price would be a little less because Darnold had two years left on his rookie deal, and he was a little younger, too.‚Äù

The Patriots drafted Jones in the first round of the 2021 NFL Draft, and he enjoyed success during his rookie season, helping New England reach the playoffs. However, the next two seasons with the Patriots didn‚Äôt go as planned, leading to New England trading Jones to the Jacksonville Jaguars in March of 2024.

Jones bounced back this season while Purdy was sidelined with an injury. He appeared in 11 games, starting eight of them, and threw for 2,151 yards along with 13 touchdowns.

There‚Äôs a possibility that Jones could return to the AFC East next season, as both the Miami Dolphins and New York Jets are expected to be on the lookout for quarterback help.

title: NFL draft update for Tennessee linebacker Arion Carter
description: Former Vol withdraws from the 2026 NFL draft and enters the NCAA transfer portal.
fullText:
Tennessee junior linebacker Arion Carter announced his intentions to declare for the NFL draft on Dec. 12, 2025. He declared for the 2026 NFL draft ahead of the Vols' loss to Illinois in the Music City Bowl to conclude their 2025 football season.

"With a lot a lot of prayer and conversations with my family and those closest to me, I've decided to declare for the NFL draft," Carter announced.

On Friday, Steve Wiltfong of On3 provided an update on the former Vol.

"Tennessee linebacker Arion Carter plans to withdraw from the NFL draft and enter the NCAA transfer portal, Steve Wiltfong reports," On3 announced.

The 6-foot-1, 235-pound linebacker appeared in 31 games for the Vols from 2023-25. He totaled 161 tackles, 13.5 tackles for a loss, 1.5 sacks, one interception, 10 pass deflections, one forced fumble and one fumble recovery.

The¬†NFL draft¬†will be held April 23‚Äì25, 2026 in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.

title: Giants' latest contract status with John Harbaugh revealed by The Athletic
description: This is dragging longer than anyone expected.
fullText:
Giants' latest contract status with John Harbaugh revealed by The Athletic originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

John Harbaugh and the New York Giants are still working on the contract that would make him their new head coach.

It doesn't sound like there's anything to worry about. But it's also a little bit odd that there has yet to be a signature.

The Athletic's Ian O'Connor reported on X Friday night that this thing isn't done yet:

"Sounds like John Harbaugh & the Giants might take this deep into the night tonight, more likely tomorrow. Things are still OK. Hang in there. Still a lot to review in contract. John & Joe Schoen have gotten along. Can't see this unraveling. Both sides know way too much at stake."

MORE:¬†Cam Ward can add John Harbaugh to his list of doubters

Harbaugh had his pick of teams as he entered coaching free agency after 18 seasons with the Baltimore Ravens that included a Super Bowl victory.

He visited the Giants on Wednesday. He was slated to interview with the Titans on Thursday and the Falcons on Friday, but those were both called off.

Initial reports of Harbaugh's hiring with the Giants came out around midnight Wednesday into Thursday.

But reports have kept trickling out that there are things still to be figured out, with ESPN's Adam Schefter reporting earlier Thursday that it was about the "language" in the contract and not the main terms.

Reports suggested Harbaugh will get approximately $100 million over five years, which would put him right with Andy Reid ($20 million per year) as the NFL's highest-paid coaches.

That is, once this deal actually gets done.

title: Texas A&M HC Bucky McMillan previews crucial road test vs. Texas
description: Coach Bucky previews the Texas matchup, stressing focus, composure, and execution as Texas A&M looks to rebound and earn a key SEC win in Austin.
fullText:
The Texas A&M basketball team enters rivalry weekend looking to reset after a grueling double‚Äëovertime loss to Tennessee. It was a tough shooting night across the board, and the Aggies will aim to get back on track Saturday when they travel to Austin to face the Texas Longhorns.

For head coach Bucky McMillan, it marks his first experience in the Lone Star Showdown ‚Äî and an opportunity to do something no A&M coach has accomplished since 2001: win in Austin. He understands exactly what this rivalry means to Aggies everywhere, but he‚Äôs also pushing his team to stay grounded and avoid getting swept up in the noise.

"¬†...our players got to block out all the noise and just know that our success going to in this game is going to be on their ability to focus on the things that equate to winning basketball"

It‚Äôs not about minimizing the rivalry, McMillan emphasized, but recognizing the bigger picture. The SEC grind is long, and every conference game carries weight. That perspective has been reinforced by A&M‚Äôs 3‚Äì1 start in league play ‚Äî a stretch that has boosted the team‚Äôs confidence despite the close calls.

"it's been great and that's why I say we can get caught up like a game slips away here or there where you're right there to win it. But there's also a lot of games on the flipside of that that we executed and won,"

A win on Saturday would move the Aggies to 4‚Äì1 in SEC play, a meaningful early‚Äëseason marker that could pay dividends later in the year. For McMillan, the message remains simple: play their style, trust their habits, and let the chips fall where they may.

Below, you can watch the full press conference with Coach Bucky.

Texas A&M will face the Texas Longhorns in Austin at the Moody Center on Saturday, January 17, at 5 p.m. CT. The matchup will air on ESPN.

title: Bavarian Loan Works: Christoph Freund dishes on three Bayern Munich loanees
description: Freund: ‚ÄúWe're in contact with the lads‚Ä¶they're on the right track"
fullText:
Bayern Munich sporting director, Christoph Freund, was asked recently about potentially terminating Jonah Kusi-Asare‚Äôs loan at Fulham early. He answered the question and then talked about two more loanees that are loaned out a little closer to home.

When asked about Kusi-Asare‚Äôs loan to the Premier League‚Äôs Fulham, Freund had this to say, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not our plan to end a loan spell early. We‚Äôre happy with how the boys are developing. Jonah Kusi-Asare has to fight his way in, he hasn‚Äôt played that many minutes yet, it‚Äôs the Premier League. His development is positive, we‚Äôre in contact with Fulham and it‚Äôs a challenge for him; he‚Äôs pushing hard and developing well.‚Äù The thought of terminating the loan could have stemmed from Peretz‚Äô situation in Hamburg, but this seems different. At this point in Kusi-Asare‚Äôs development, Fulham is probably a great spot for him to be.

Freund went onto talk about Noel Aseko, who is on loan in the 2. Bundesliga with Hannover 96: ‚ÄúNo√´l As√©ko is doing really well at Hannover, and it was important for him to stay fit over a longer period of time. He‚Äôs on the right track, it‚Äôs a great loan.‚Äù He has appeared in all 17 league marches ‚Äî starting in 15 of them ‚Äî plus two matches and a handful of call ups to the Germany U-21s since going on loan. He has scored two goals and assisted three.

Jonathan Asp-Jensen was the last Bayern loanee that Freund mentioned. He called him ‚Äúan absolute leader,‚Äú and added that ‚Äùhe‚Äôs scored goals and is developing superbly.‚Äú Asp has scored four goals and recorded six assists in 17 league matches and has also appeared in three cup matches. Despite a subpar season for the team, Asp is shining bright.

Freund ended his comments with this, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre in contact with the lads, the crucial factor is how they develop ‚Äì because the jump to Bayern is a big one. But they‚Äôre on the right track.‚Äù Who are you the most excited loanee to watch for the rest of the season?

title: Buffalo Bills OC Joe Brady to interview for 3 NFL HC openings on Sunday
description: Buffalo Bills offensive coordinator Joe Brady has been a hot name during the latest NFL head coach hiring cycle.
fullText:
The NFL postseason is a busy time for playoff teams, but also for those teams set to reset their organizations after previous shortcomings. For many offensive and defensive coordinators in the playoffs, January is a month filled with stressful game planning but also prepping for potentially life-changing head coaching interviews.

That‚Äôs true of Buffalo Bills offensive coordinator Joe Brady, who is set to interview for three NFL head coach openings on Sunday, less than 24 hours after Buffalo‚Äôs game against the Denver Broncos concludes. Per NFL National Insider Ian Rapoport, Brady will ‚Äúspeak‚Äù with senior front-office personnel of both the Baltimore Ravens and Atlanta Falcons on Sunday, January 18.

Albert Breer reported that Brady is also set to interview with the Las Vegas Raiders, for their head coach opening. Brady has been a popular name to eventually take over as an NFL team‚Äôs head coach since the end of last season, with four NFL teams requesting permission to interview him this cycle so far. The 36-year-old Florida native has already interviewed with the Miami Dolphins.

Following his ascension to Bills OC midway through the 2023 NFL season, Brady found success almost immediately while in charge of directing Buffalo offense ‚Äî one now led by current NFL MVP quarterback Josh Allen. Despite fielding one of the league‚Äôs least fear-inducing wide receiver groups, Brady has continued to get meaningful production out of every jersey number on offense.

Buffalo finished the 2025 season top five in total offense, boasted the NFL‚Äôs top yards/game rushing attack and the league-leading rusher in running back James Cook III ‚Äî who finished with 1,621 rushing yards and 12 touchdowns, and was named Associated Press Second-Team All-Pro.

title: Nets' Jordi Fernandez explains putting Drake Powell in starting lineup
description: Brooklyn Nets head coach Jordi Fernandez recently put rookie Drake Powell in the starting lineup and he explained the reason for the move.
fullText:
NEW YORK -- Brooklyn Nets rookie forward Drake Powell has had the typical kind of rookie season where he had fair share of ups and downs as he adjusted to the NBA. Brooklyn head coach Jordi Fernandez has been trying to find the best starting lineup that he can put out on any given night and he recently took some time to explain starting the rookie.

"Drake did an amazing job last game, we believe he can be not just a good but a great two-way player, which means that, you know, he's going to be a very good defender," Fernandez said prior to Friday's matchup against the Chicago Bulls. Powell entered the starting lineup for Monday's 113-105 loss at the Dallas Mavericks and it seems like he's going to remain in the starting five for the time being.

"I see him as a very good shooter, a very good playmaker, I can run plays for him on the second side, he can handle in transition, he can guard the best perimeter player, his athleticism is top in the NBA for his position," Fernandez continued. "I just want more consistency, and I want more from him, and I keep demanding that. Starting is not a guarantee, he's going to have to keep trying really hard and have the good intentions."

Powell, 20, is averaging 6.4 points, 1.7 rebounds, and 1.6 assists per game while shooting 47.1% from the field and 31.3% from three-point range in 28 games played this season. Over the last two games, Powell has looked like the kind of player that can make an impact on both ends of the floor for the Nets, despite the fact that Brooklyn finished with an 0-2 record over that stretch.

In his last two starts, Powell is averaging 13.0 points, 3.0 rebounds, and 1.0 assists per game while shooting 55.0% from the floor and 22.2% from deep in 24.5 minutes per game. More to the point, Fernandez is seeing what he wants to see from the former North Carolina Tar Heel and that explains why Powell remains in the starting lineup for Friday's matchup against Chicago.

Nets starters for tonight's game against the Bulls:

Egor Demin
Drake Powell
Michael Porter Jr.
Noah Clowney
Nic Claxton

title: Ole Miss QB Trinidad Chambliss sues NCAA for extra year of eligibility
description: The suit filed in Lafayette County came a week after the NCAA denied Ole Miss‚Äô request for an extra year.
fullText:
Mississippi quarterback Trinidad Chambliss sued the NCAA in state court on Friday for an additional year of eligibility so he can play for the Rebels next season.

The suit filed in Lafayette County came a week after the NCAA denied Ole Miss‚Äô request for an extra year, saying the university and Chambliss‚Äô previous school ‚Äî Ferris State ‚Äî failed to provide adequate medical documentation to back up the request.

The lawsuit filed Friday called the NCAA‚Äôs denial in ‚Äúbad-faith, unreasonable and arbitrary,‚Äù and detailed Chambliss‚Äô history of illness and included letters from physicians.

‚ÄúDespite the duty of good faith and fair dealing it owes to Trinidad, the NCAA insists on considering the evidence in Trinidad‚Äôs case in an isolated, rather than comprehensive manner; interpreting its rules to impose requirements not contained therein; taking unreasonable if not irrational positions; and acting in an arbitrary and capricious manner in its decision-making and ruling,‚Äù the suit says.

Ole Miss‚Äô arguments revolve around the fact that the 23-year-old Chambliss, although he has been in college for five years, has only played three years of college football because of that medical history.

‚ÄúTrinidad first enrolled in Ferris State in the fall of 2021, but medical and physical incapacity prevented his ability to adequately train and condition and develop athletically,‚Äù the suit says.

After taking a redshirt his first season at Ferris State in 2021-22, Chambliss was held out in his second season for medical reasons.

‚ÄúObviously, Trinidad‚Äôs medical conditions, which rendered him incapable of competing in any game during these years, were beyond his or Ferris State‚Äôs control,‚Äù the suit says.

He played two more seasons at the Division II school in Michigan, leading the Bulldogs to a national championship before transferring to Ole Miss before the start of this season.

Chambliss completed 294 of 445 passes (66.1%) for 3,937 yards with 22 touchdowns and three interceptions for Ole Miss (13-2), which set a school record for wins, including two after making the College Football Playoff for the first time. He ran for 527 yards and eight more TDs.

The Rebels lost 31-27 to Miami in the College Football Playoff semifinals on Jan. 8.

The NCAA, when contacted Friday, did not have a new statement, but referred to its statement from a week ago saying, ‚ÄúThis decision aligns with consistent application of NCAA rules.‚Äù

The NCAA said in that week-old statement that approval of such waivers requires schools to submit medical documentation from a treating physician at the time of a student‚Äôs incapacitating injury or illness.

‚ÄúThe documents provided by Ole Miss and the student‚Äôs prior school include a physician‚Äôs note from a December 2022 visit, which stated the student-athlete was ‚Äòdoing very well‚Äô since he was seen in August 2022,‚Äù the NCAA said. ‚ÄúAdditionally, the student-athletes prior school indicated it had no documentation on medical treatment, injury reports or medical conditions involving the student-athlete during that time frame and cited ‚Äòdevelopmental needs and our team‚Äôs competitive circumstances‚Äô as its reason the student-athlete did not play in the 2022-23 season.‚Äù

Ole Miss athletic director Keith Carter previously said the school will appeal the NCAA‚Äôs ruling.

title: UNC basketball falls in latest NET rankings
description: UNC basketball has fallen in the latest NET rankings after a loss
fullText:
The North Carolina Tar Heels will stay out west this weekend as they play game two of a two-game road trip in the Atlantic Coast Conference. As UNC prepares to rebound and seek a win against Cal, its NET ranking has been updated.

And after the loss to Stanford, UNC has moved back.

UNC has moved back a bit as they now rank No. 30 in the NET following the loss to Stanford. That loss moved them from the 20's now back to 30 with the 14-3 record.

They are also now 3-3 in Quad 1 games, 1-0 in Quad 2, 4-0 in Quad 3, and 6-0 in Quad 4. They don't have any bad losses, and all three of their losses are Quad 1. Those losses came on a neutral court to Michigan State, on the road at SMU and on the road at Stanford.

The good news is that UNC will have a few more Quad 1 opportunities as the ACC is a lot stronger this season. But those games have been a struggle for Hubert Davis and his team so far in his tenure.

title: Nebraska MBB Opponent Preview: Northwestern
description: To the greater Chicago area‚Ä¶
fullText:
Saturday‚Äôs game will be broadcast on BTN with Chris Vosters and Brian Butch on the call. It will also be available online on the FOX Sports and FOX Sports 1 apps.

Saturday‚Äôs game will be carried on the Huskers Radio Network with Kent Pavelka and Jeff Smith on the call, including KLIN (1400 AM) in Lincoln, KCRO (660 AM) and KIBM (1490 AM) in Omaha and KRVN (880 AM) in Lexington. The pregame show begins an hour before tipoff and will also be available on Huskers.com and the Huskers app.

The No. 8/10 (AP/Coaches) Nebraska men‚Äôs basketball team hits the road Saturday afternoon, as the Huskers travel to Northwestern. Tipoff from Welsh-Ryan Arena in Evanston is set for shortly after 8 p.m. and the game will be carried nationally on BTN and broadcast on the Huskers Radio Network, as well as on Huskers.com and on the official Huskers app.

The Huskers (17-0, 7-0 B1G) come off a 90-55 win over Oregon Tuesday evening in Lincoln. Nebraska matched its season high with 17 3-pointers, including seven each from¬†Pryce Sandfort¬†and¬†Braden Frager, as the duo combined for 51 points. Nebraska shot 53 percent from the field and turned 16 Duck turnovers into 23 points, posting its largest winning margin in a conference game since Jan. 9, 1994.

Northwestern (8-9, 0-6 B1G) comes off a 79-68 loss to No. 13 Illinois on Wednesday. Jayden Reid, who had started Northwestern‚Äôs first 16 games, came off the bench and had a career-high 28 points, including 4-of-6 from 3-point range, while Nick Martinelli added 20. Martinelli is tied for the national lead in scoring at 23.8 points per game.

The Huskers, whose 17-0 start is the best in program history, matched their best ranking in school history as the Huskers were eighth in Monday‚Äôs AP poll. NU was also ranked eighth for a week during the 1965-66 season. The Huskers are 6-0 in the Big Ten and a win Saturday would match NU‚Äôs best conference start since WW2, a 7-0 mark by the 1965-66 Huskers.

The Huskers improved to 46-22 (.677) all-time when ranked in the AP poll following the win over Oregon. According to BTN Research, Nebraska‚Äôs 17-0 start is the best by a Big Ten team since Michigan opened the 2018-19 season with 17 straight wins. A win on Saturday would mark the best start by a Big Ten team since 2010-11 when Ohio State opened the year with 24 straight wins.

title: Athletics hire Bill Schmidt, former Rockies GM, as special assistant to scouting
description: The Athletics hired former Colorado Rockies general manager Bill Schmidt as the club's special assistant to the scouting department, the team announced Friday.  Schmidt was appointed senior vice president and general manager of the Rockies in October 2021 and served four seasons in the role.  Before joining the Rockies, Schmidt served as a national crosschecker with Cleveland (1995-99) and as a supervisor of the Southern California, Arizona, and Nevada regions for the Yankees (1988-95).
fullText:
WEST SACRAMENTO, Calif. (AP) ‚Äî The Athletics hired former Colorado Rockies general manager Bill Schmidt as the club's special assistant to the scouting department, the team announced Friday.

Schmidt was appointed senior vice president and general manager of the Rockies in October 2021 and served four seasons in the role. He joined the Rockies in 1999 and served as vice president of scouting dating to 2007.

Before joining the Rockies, Schmidt served as a national crosschecker with Cleveland (1995-99) and as a supervisor of the Southern California, Arizona, and Nevada regions for the Yankees (1988-95).

He also worked for the MLB Scouting Bureau from 1987-88 and began his scouting career with the Cincinnati Reds in the early 1980s.

Schmidt was named the 2019 West Coast Scout of the Year and was bestowed the Legends in Scouting Award.

The A‚Äôs relocated to West Sacramento, California, last year to play the first of three planned seasons in the city‚Äôs Triple-A ballpark before moving into a new ballpark in Las Vegas.

A $2 billion, 33,000-capacity stadium on the Las Vegas Strip is under construction. Club officials told the Las Vegas Stadium Authority on Dec. 4 that the ballpark is on schedule to open in time for the 2028 season.

title: Anytime Touchdown Scorer Bills vs Broncos Prediction: TD Picks for AFC Divisional Round
description: Expect Sean Payton to deploy a run-heavy game plan, and RJ Harvey should be the primary beneficiary in the red zone.
fullText:
The Denver Broncos welcome the Buffalo Bills to town to open the AFC Divisional round on Saturday afternoon.

Josh Allen leads the Bills as he looks to finally reach the NFL‚Äôs promised land, but he‚Äôll face a Broncos team boasting a nasty defense and a rookie running back in RJ Harvey, who closed the season strong.

Those two players headline my Bills vs. Broncos anytime touchdown picks for January 17.

For more NFL picks, make sure to check out our full Bills vs. Broncos predictions!

What‚Äôs a quarterback to do when his receiving corps is depleted by injuries, his running back is facing the NFL‚Äôs second-best run defense, and he still has to score against the league‚Äôs top red-zone efficiency defense?

When that quarterback is Josh Allen, the answer is simple: keep doing what he‚Äôs always done for the Buffalo Bills.

Last week, that meant scoring two of Buffalo‚Äôs three touchdowns with his legs via the tush push. One of those came after Allen nearly scored on a tush push that started from 10 yards out.

James Cook was held to 46 yards on 15 carries by Jacksonville‚Äôs elite run defense, and a similar script could unfold against the Denver Broncos. When the Bills get near the goal line, Allen remains their most dangerous weapon.

Allen has rushed for two touchdowns in each of his last two full games, and I love the -110 price for him to find the end zone again.

With J.K. Dobbins still sidelined, RJ Harvey has seen a significant uptick in usage over the past six games, particularly in the passing game. That expanded role has paid off, as he‚Äôs scored in five of those six contests, finding the end zone six times in total.

Even with injuries in Buffalo‚Äôs secondary, the Bills‚Äô pass defense remains solid. That should further tilt Denver toward the ground. Harvey leads the Broncos in carries inside both the 10-yard and 5-yard lines, putting him in a prime position to punch one in against this porous Buffalo run defense.

As a bonus, Harvey to score twice at +500 is worth a look. Travis Etienne Jr. caught a touchdown pass against Buffalo last week, and Harvey‚Äôs involvement as a receiver gives him a legitimate path to multiple scores.
